snippet: The return of 1970s-era gas lines to the five boroughs of New York City was not the result of a single miscalculation, but a combination of ignored warnings and indecisiveness.
abstract: Return of 1970s-era gas lines in New York City following Hurricane Sandy resulted from combination of missed opportunities, ignored warnings and lack of decisiveness by Gov Andrew M Cuomo, Mayor MIchael R Bloomberg and other officials; industry experts say gas shortages, and perhaps rationing, could now persist up to the Thanksgiving holiday.

byline.original: By DAVID W. CHEN, WINNIE HU and CLIFFORD KRAUSS
byline.contributor: Andy Newman and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The return of 1970s-era gas lines to the five boroughs of New York City was not the result of a single miscalculation, but a combination of ignored warnings and indecisiveness.

headline.seo: In New York Gas Shortage, Missed Opportunities and Miscalculations
headline.main: Behind New York Gas Lines, Warnings and Crossed Fingers
headline.print_headline: Behind New York Gas Lines, Warnings and Crossed Fingers
